title: Larry Summers joins Afterpay advisory board
text:
Former US Treasury Secretary Larry Summers has joined Afterpay's new advisory board in the United States, where the fast-growing retailing platform has 40 per cent of its customers.

Afterpay said it hoped the move will help it to "identify key business opportunities and partnerships at a time when American consumers are increasingly turning to alternative payment methods to avoid revolving and extended debt".

The company said at its full-year results announcement in August it had more than 6,500 merchants offering the instalment payments service in the United States and 2.1 million active customers there. Its strong performance on the Australian sharemarket is being driven by expectations of further US growth.

Mr Summers, one of the world's best known economists and a former economic adviser to president Barack Obama, said Afterpay is "reinventing the way people shop and pay with alternatives to traditional credit that encourage responsible spending and control in how consumers pay".

“I look forward to working with the leadership team to make the most of the opportunity before them,” he said in a statement.

The other members of the new US advisory board are former Reebok CEO Uli Becker and Matthew Kaness, former CEO of ModCloth, a US women's fashion retailer.
description: The former US Treasury Secretary says he wants to work with Nick Molnar to "make the most of the opportunity" in offering alternatives to traditional credit.
